p: Samples such as urine and saliva have been used to detect flaviviruses, including ZIKV and WNV. This sample collection is non-invasive and may improve tests for routine surveillance and research involving infants and young children [38]. Further, ZIKV RNA has been detected in urine at higher levels and for an extended period time, up to 36 days after disease onset [39]. The choice of diagnostic test will depend on time of sample collection and the goal of the assay.
